com.ge.dspmicro.httpclient.api

Interface IHttpClient


  • public interface IHttpClient
    Http client interface class that expose functions for simple http connections that are managed by a pooling connection manager. PoolingHttpClientConnectionManager manages a pool of client connections and is able to service connection requests from multiple execution threads. Connections are pooled on a per route basis. A request for a route for which the manager already has a persistent connection available in the pool will be serviced by leasing a connection from the pool rather than creating a brand new connection. PoolingHttpClientConnectionManager maintains a maximum limit of connections on a per route basis and in total. The number of concurrent connections per given route can be configured through com.ge.dspmicro.httpclient.connection.maxPerRoute and the number of connections in total can be configured through com.ge.dspmicro.httpclient.connection.maxPerRoute.

      • sendRequestAsync

        Future<org.apache.http.HttpResponse> sendRequestAsync(org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpUriRequest httpRequest)
        Sends a request in a different thread. This does not use asnynchronous I/O as the name implies, but simply allows the caller to return immediately instead of blocking on the send operation.
        Parameters:
        httpRequest - The request to send
        Returns:
        A Future that can be used to wait for the result and get it once finished
        Since:
        15.3.0

      • getDefaultRequestConfig

        org.apache.http.client.config.RequestConfig getDefaultRequestConfig()
        Returns:
        default request configuration

      • setAllowSSL

        void setAllowSSL(IHttpClient.sslType sslType,
               org.apache.http.conn.ssl.X509HostnameVerifier hostnameVerifier)
        setAllowSSL actually rebuilds the internal httpClient so this is not something that should reset but instead set once. Note: This affects all services using this instance.
        Parameters:
        sslType - Type of SSL Context to set 0 - NO_SSL, Allow only HTTP request 1 - ALLOW_DEFAULT_CERTS, Allow use of container default certs 2 - ALLOW_ALL_HOSTNAME_VERIFIER, Allow trust of all certs without hostname verifier
        hostnameVerifier - X509HostnameVerifier to set
